alert.note: Alert for Phillips (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 8:42AM CDT until May 09 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PHILLIPS...WEST CENTRAL FRANKLIN...SOUTHERN PHELPS...FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 842 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Loomis to near Oxford to near Wilsonville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported another round of half dollar size hail in Edison. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Oxford, Loomis and Stamford around 845 AM CDT. Atlanta around 850 AM CDT. Holdrege around 855 AM CDT. Orleans around 900 AM CDT. Alma and Huntley around 910 AM CDT. Ragan around 915 AM CDT. Republican City and Harlan County Dam around 925 AM CDT. Long Island around 930 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
